oid

Provides a strong type for Object Identifiers as specified in X.690, published by the International Telecommunications Union, as well as related exceptions.

Note that all OIDs are limited by this implementation to 64 nodes, and each node's number may range from zero to ulong.max. Each node descriptor may only be up to 65536 characters long. This is to prevent denial of service attacks involving extraordinarily long OIDs, numbers, or descriptors.

Author:
Jonathan M. Wilbur

Date:
February 25th, 2017

License:
Boost License 1.0

Standards:
X.690

Version:
0.9.0

See Also:
X.690 Wikipedia: Object Identifier

class OIDException: object.Exception;
A generic OID-related exception

class OIDLengthException: oid.OIDException;
Thrown if the OID is more than 64 nodes long. This is thrown to prevent OID-related denial-of-service attacks.

class OIDNumberException: oid.OIDException;
Thrown if an OID node number is negative or larger than ulong.max.

class OIDDescriptorException: oid.OIDException;
Thrown if the object descriptor is not entirely graphical characters or if the descriptor is longer than 65536 characters. See Wikipedia: Graphic Characters for more information on what constitutes Graphic Characters. Also, see std.ascii.isGraphical.

class OID;
A class for Object Identifiers, that supports object descriptors and various output formatting.

struct OIDNode;
A struct representing a single node in an OID, which has a mandatory number and an optional descriptor.

this(T)(T number, string descriptor = "") if (isIntegral!T);
The constructor for OIDNode

Returns:
An OIDNode

Throws:
OIDNumberException if the number is negative or greater than ulong.max OIDDescriptorException if the descriptor is greater than 65536 characters long or contains non graphic characters

See Also:
Wikipedia: Graphic Characters

Examples:
OIDNode node = OIDNode(1234, "boop");
assert(node.number == 1234L);
assert(node.descriptor == "boop");


@property ulong number();
Returns:
the number associated with this OIDNode

Examples:
OIDNode node = OIDNode(0x03);
assert(node.number == 3L);


@property string descriptor();
Returns:
the descriptor associated with this OIDNode

Examples:
OIDNode node = OIDNode(0x03, "blap");
assert(node.descriptor == "blap");


@property void number(T)(T number) if (isIntegral!T);
Sets the number associated with this OIDNode, casting it as a ulong in the process

Throws:
OIDNumberException if the number is negative or greater than ulong.max

Examples:
OIDNode node = OIDNode(5, "blip");
node.number = 0x06;
assert(node.number == 6L);


@property void descriptor(string descriptor);
Sets the descriptor associated with this OIDNode

Throws:
OIDDescriptorException if the descriptor is greater than 65536 characters long, or contains non-graphic characters.

See Also:
Wikipedia: Graphic Characters

Examples:
OIDNode node = OIDNode(0x08, "dangitbobby");
node.descriptor = "butdad";
assert(node.descriptor == "butdad");


this(T)(T[] oidNumberArray...) if (isIntegral!T);
Constructor for OID.

Params:
T[] oidNumberArray An array of any integers of any integral type representing the sequence of node numbers that constitute the OID.

Returns:
An OID object with no descriptors.

Throws:
OIDLengthException if the array is empty OIDNumberException if any number is negative or greater than ulong.max

Examples:
assertNotThrown!OIDException
    (enforce!OIDException(new OID([1, 22, 333]), "Exception thrown!"));
assertThrown!OIDNumberException
    (enforce!OIDNumberException(new OID([1, 22, -333]), "Negative numbers in OID."));
assertThrown!OIDLengthException
    (enforce!OIDLengthException(new OID([]), "No OID numbers provided to constructor."));


this(OIDNode[] nodes...);
Constructor for OID

Params:
oidnodes An array of OIDNodes

Returns:
An OID object

Throws:
OIDLengthException if number of oidnodes (length of OID) is negative or greater than 64

Examples:
OIDNode node1 = OIDNode(1, "iso");
OIDNode node2 = OIDNode(3, "");
OIDNode node3 = OIDNode(6, "dod");
OID oid = new OID(node1, node2, node3);
assert(oid.dotNotation == "iso.3.dod");

// Try to create an OID greater than 64 nodes long.
OIDNode[] nodes = [];
for (int i = 0; i < 70; i++)
{
    nodes ~= OIDNode(7, "fail");
}
assertThrown!OIDLengthException
    (enforce!OIDLengthException(new OID(nodes)));


string descriptor(T)(T index) if (isIntegral!T);
Returns:
The descriptor at the specified index.

Examples:
OID oid = new OID([1, 3, 6]);
oid.descriptor(0, "iso");
oid.descriptor(1, "");
oid.descriptor(2, "dod");
assert(oid.descriptor(0) == "iso");
assert(oid.descriptor(1) == "");
assert(oid.descriptor(2) == "dod");


void descriptor(T)(T index, string descriptor) if (isIntegral!T);
Supplies a node descriptor for a node at a specified index in the OID

Params:
T index an integer specifying an index of the node you wish to change
string descriptor the actual text that you want associated with a node. This must be composed of only Graphic Characters.

Throws:
RangeError if the node addressed is non-existent or negative. OIDDescriptorException if the descriptor is too long or non graphical.

Examples:
OID oid = new OID([1, 3, 6]);
oid.descriptor(0, "iso");
oid.descriptor(1, "");
oid.descriptor(2, "dod");
assert(oid.dotNotation() == "iso.3.dod");


string[] descriptors();
Returns:
an array of all descriptors in order

Examples:
OID oid = new OID([1, 3, 6]);
oid.descriptor(0, "iso");
oid.descriptor(1, "");
oid.descriptor(2, "dod");
assert(oid.descriptors() == [ "iso", "", "dod"]);


void descriptors(string[] descriptors...);
Supplies multiple descriptors for nodes in the OID

Params:
string[] descriptors descriptors for each node in order

Throws:
RangeError if the node addressed is non-existent or negative. OIDLengthException if the number of descriptors is more than 64. OIDDescriptorException if the descriptor is too long or non-graphical.

Examples:
OID oid = new OID([1, 3, 6, 1]);
oid.descriptors("iso", "", "dod", "internet");
assert(oid.descriptors() == [ "iso", "", "dod", "internet" ]);


@property ulong[] numericArray();
Returns:
an array of ulongs representing the dot-delimited sequence of integers that constitute the numeric OID

Examples:
OID oid = new OID([1, 3, 6, 1]);
assert(oid.numericArray == [ 1L, 3L, 6L, 1L]);


@property string asn1Notation();
Returns:
the OID in ASN.1 Notation

Examples:
OID oid = new OID([1, 22, 333, 4444, 55555]);
oid.descriptor(2, "boop");
assert(oid.asn1Notation == "{1 22 boop(333) 4444 55555}");


@property string dotNotation();
Returns:
the OID as a dot-delimited string, where all nodes with descriptors are represented as descriptors instead of numbers

Examples:
OID oid = new OID([1, 22, 333, 4444, 55555]);
oid.descriptor(2, "boop");
assert(oid.dotNotation == "1.22.boop.4444.55555");


@property string iriNotation();
Returns:
the OID as a forward-slash-delimited string (as one might expect in a URI / IRI path), where all nodes with descriptors are represented as descriptors instead of numbers

Examples:
OID oid = new OID([1, 22, 333, 4444, 55555]);
oid.descriptor(2, "boop");
assert(oid.iriNotation == "/1/22/boop/4444/55555");


@property string urnNotation();
Returns:
the OID as a URN, where all nodes of the OID are translated to a segment in the URN path, and where all nodes are represented as numbers regardless of whether or not they have a descriptor

See Also:
RFC 3061

Examples:
OID oid = new OID([1, 22, 333, 4444, 55555]);
oid.descriptor(2, "boop"); // This does not affect the URN.
assert(oid.urnNotation == "urn:oid:1:22:333:4444:55555");


@property int length();
Returns:
the number of nodes in the OID.
